ygData.subject: (Was: Two of the same weapon) New Word
ygData.msgSnippet: Personally, I like the term juggling .  It sounds more like a Skill than a keyboarding technique ... From: Roop Dirump  To:
ygData.messageBody:
Personally, I like the term "juggling". It sounds more like a Skill than a
keyboarding technique
-----Original Message-----
From: Roop Dirump <roop@...>
To: eqbards@onelist.com <eqbards@onelist.com>
Date: Thursday, July 08, 1999 6:08 AM
Subject: Re: [eqbards] Two of the same weapon


>From: "Roop Dirump" <roop@...>
>
>
>
>>From: "J.M. Capozzi" <croak63@...>
>>
>snip
>>
>>Also, this is off-topic to this thread, but in response to someone who
felt
>>'twisting' (BTW, 10 free brownie points if you can point me to the person
>>that coined that term...and an evil and painful death for him..I really
>>dislike it) was an exploit.
>
>
>Ehehe. Juggling always had more charm. Twisting seems to be the term used
>here, but actually in-game people seem to use the word, "stacking," from my
>experiences (ie. I stacked Accelerando and Hymn as we outran the werewolf).
>Maybe we should all put our heads together and come up with a better term
>for this! Then we all agree to use it!
>
>I say Orchestrated! Yes, I am creating my own symphony... nah too long.
>How about Jam? As in, "Jam Anthem and Purity on this one." Ah, then I
feel
>like a gargage band guitarist.
>
>Ah well, it'll always be twisting probably.
>
>Roop
>
